subject: Communication
title: The Reciprocity Trap
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Reciprocity Trap.

hook.text: A Hare Krishna hands you a flower at the airport. You didn't want it. Now you feel obligated to donate.

buildup.text: Reciprocity is one of the strongest social forces: when someone gives, we feel compelled to give back.

discovery.text: Studies show people return favors even when they didn't ask for the original gift and don't like the giver.

twist.text: The gift doesn't need to be equal. A free sample worth $0.50 can trigger a $50 purchase.

climax.text: Supermarkets, salespeople, and diplomats all exploit reciprocity â€” give first, then ask.

punchline.text: Free gifts are never free. They're invoices in disguise.

quiz.question: Why does reciprocity work as a persuasion tool?
options: We feel obligated to return favors
